steps.title: Day 1: Docker Core Concepts
steps.goal: Understand what Docker is, its core components (images, containers, Dockerfile), and how it differs from traditional virtualization.
actions: Read the Docker 'Get Started: Overview' documentation to understand containers and compare them to virtual machines (25 min).
Study the concepts of Docker Images and Containers by reading Part 1 of the 'Get Started' guide (25 min).
Review the official documentation for the three fundamental Docker CLI commands: `docker run`, `docker build`, and `docker ps` (20 min).
Write a one-paragraph summary for each of the following: Image, Container, and Dockerfile, explaining how they relate to each other (20 min).
steps.completion_check: You're done when you can explain the difference between a Docker image and a container, and describe the purpose of a Dockerfile to a colleague.

steps.title: Container Image Design Best Practices
steps.goal: Understand the core principles of creating small, secure, and efficient container images using Dockerfile best practices.
actions: Read the 'Use multi-stage builds' and 'Don't install unnecessary packages' sections of the official Dockerfile best practices guide (25 min).
Read the 'Minimize the number of layers' and 'Leverage build cache' sections of the Dockerfile best practices guide, focusing on how `RUN` commands can be combined (25 min).
Read the 'Choose a base image' section, paying close attention to the pros and cons of distroless, Alpine, and slim variants (20 min).
Write a 5-point checklist for creating a production-ready container image, summarizing the key principles you just researched (20 min).
steps.completion_check: You're done when you have created a 5-point checklist for optimizing a Dockerfile and can explain the purpose of a multi-stage build.

steps.title: Kubernetes Core Concepts
steps.goal: Understand the fundamental components of Kubernetes: Nodes, Pods, Deployments, and Services, and how they relate to each other.
actions: Read the 'What is Kubernetes?' and 'Kubernetes Components' sections of the official documentation to understand the overall architecture (Control Plane, Nodes) (25 min)
Read the 'Pods' concept page in the Kubernetes documentation, focusing on what a Pod is, why it's needed, and its lifecycle (20 min)
Read the 'Deployments' concept page, focusing on how they manage ReplicaSets and Pods to provide declarative updates and scaling (25 min)
Read the 'Services' concept page to learn how they provide a stable network endpoint for a dynamic set of Pods (20 min)
steps.completion_check: You're done when you can draw a simple diagram showing how a Service exposes a set of Pods managed by a Deployment on a Node, and can explain the role of each component.

steps.title: Foundations of Kubernetes Operations
steps.goal: Understand the core concepts of Kubernetes operations, including monitoring, logging, and troubleshooting common cluster issues.
actions: Read the official Kubernetes documentation on 'Monitoring' concepts, focusing on the metrics pipeline and available tools (25 min).
Study the official Kubernetes documentation on 'Logging Architecture', identifying the difference between node-level and cluster-level logging (25 min).
Review the 'Troubleshooting' guides in the official Kubernetes documentation, focusing on the common steps for debugging applications and clusters (25 min).
Write a 1-page summary comparing the roles of monitoring, logging, and tracing in Kubernetes operations based on your research (15 min).
steps.completion_check: You're done when you can outline the standard approaches for monitoring, logging, and troubleshooting a Kubernetes cluster using the official documentation as a reference.

steps.title: Core CI/CD Concepts and Terminology
steps.goal: Understand the fundamental principles, benefits, and key terminology of Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and Continuous Deployment.
actions: Read Atlassian's guide on 'Continuous integration vs. continuous delivery vs. continuous deployment' to understand the core differences (25 min).
Read the 'Continuous Integration' and 'Continuous Delivery/Deployment' sections of the AWS CI/CD whitepaper, focusing on source control, build, test, and release automation stages (25 min).
Watch the 'What is CI/CD?' video by IBM Cloud (15 min) to visualize the pipeline and workflow from code commit to production.
Write a 1-paragraph summary for each of the following: Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and Continuous Deployment, explaining their purpose and key activities in your own words (25 min).
steps.completion_check: You're done when you can explain the difference between CI, Continuous Delivery, and Continuous Deployment, and list the typical stages in a CI/CD pipeline (e.g., source, build, test, deploy).

steps.title: CI/CD Tooling Landscape: Jenkins, GitLab, and GitHub Actions
steps.goal: Understand the core concepts and key differences between three major CI/CD tools to inform tool selection.
actions: Research Jenkins: Read the 'What is Jenkins?' and 'Getting Started with Pipeline' sections of the official documentation to understand its architecture (controller/agent, plugins) and pipeline-as-code (Jenkinsfile). (25 min)
Research GitLab CI/CD: Read the 'Introduction to GitLab CI/CD' and 'CI/CD concepts' documentation to understand its integrated approach, runners, and the `.gitlab-ci.yml` file structure. (25 min)
Research GitHub Actions: Read the 'Understanding GitHub Actions' and 'Core concepts for GitHub Actions' documentation to learn about workflows, events, jobs, and runners. (25 min)
Create a 3-column comparison table summarizing the key features, pipeline syntax (e.g., Jenkinsfile vs .yml), and hosting model (self-hosted vs SaaS) for each of the three tools. (15 min)
steps.completion_check: You're done when you have a comparison table outlining the core concepts, syntax, and hosting options for Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, and GitHub Actions.

steps.title: Day 7: Containerized Deployment Automation
steps.goal: Understand and practice Containerized Deployment Automation concepts
actions: Study: Research: Containerized Deployment Automation (Self-directed)
Take notes on key concepts from Containerized Deployment Automation
Create a summary of what you learned
steps.completion_check: You can explain the key concepts of Containerized Deployment Automation
